newsitem.title: USA: Clinton to help clean up Pennsylvania community. [CORRECTED 23:00 GMT]
newsitem.headline: Clinton to help clean up Pennsylvania community. [CORRECTED 23:00 GMT]

text.p: President Clinton will lend a hand in a Germantown, Pa., clean-up campaign when he goes to Philadelphia for a summit on volunteerism next month, the White House said Tuesday.
Clinton will participate in the summit April 27 and 28 along with former Presidents George Bush, Gerald Ford and Jimmy Carter.

Before the meeting, Clinton and his wife Hillary and Vice President Al Gore and his wife Tipper will help residents of Germantown, a Philadelphia neighbourhood (corrects from suburb) erase graffiti and spruce up community parks, according to White House spokesman Mike McCurry.

George Washington's Continental Army attacked the British at Germantown shortly after the fall of Philadelphia in 1777, the so-called Year of the Hangman. After being beaten off, the Continentals retired to Valley Forge for the winter.
